info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 4:34PM MDT by NWS Pueblo CO
info.description:
At 432 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles north of Greenhorn Mountain, or 28 miles southwest of Pueblo. This thunderstorm was nearly stationary. This storm is directly west of the Oak Ridge Burn scar and was drifting slowly east.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. Torrential rain fall will also occur with this storm.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible.
Locations impacted include... Oak Ridge Burn Scar.
If this storm moves over the burn scar, a flash flood warning will likely be issued.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
